summary: An email from Matt McDonald, Managing Editor of The Spectator US, to an unnamed recipient, seeking comment on a story about Prince Andrew's correspondence with the Southern District of New York (SDNY). The email contains excerpts from a story by writer Dominic Green, which alleges that then-U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman misled the public about Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation and breached DOJ rules in his public statements.

persons.name: Matt McDonald
persons.context: Author of the email, seeking comment on a story about Prince Andrew and the SDNY.

persons.name: Dominic Green
persons.context: Writer of the story about Prince Andrew's correspondence with the SDNY, excerpts of which are quoted in the email.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.role: Duke of York, Witness/Subject of Investigation
persons.context: The subject of the story; his legal team is described as having an email trail proving cooperation with the SDNY, which he was approached as a witness after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Then-U.S. Attorney who publicly denounced Prince Andrew for non-cooperation; the story alleges he misled the media and breached DOJ rules.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as the deceased financier whose crimes Prince Andrew was asked about as a witness.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, publicly criticized Andrew for non-cooperation, while Andrew's legal team claims to have been negotiating in good faith with the SDNY.
The document states the DOJ approached Andrew as a witness regarding Epstein's crimes after Epstein's death.

events.title: Berman's Public Denunciation of Prince Andrew
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman denounced Prince Andrew from the steps of Epstein's Manhattan townhouse, claiming a 'wall of silence' and 'zero co-operation' from him.

events.title: BBC Broadcast of Accusations
events.description: The BBC broadcast accusations (presumably related to Epstein) in November 2019, after which the DOJ approached Prince Andrew.

events.title: Prince Andrew's Legal Team Drafts Proposal
events.description: In early January 2020, Prince Andrew's new legal team suggested drafting a proposal for how he would deliver a witness statement to the DOJ, which the DOJ accepted.

keyFacts: The document contains allegations that U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman 'actively misled' the media about Prince Andrew's lack of cooperation with the SDNY investigation.
Prince Andrew's legal team claims to have 'dozens of email exchanges' with the SDNY proving 'full cooperation,' contradicting Berman's public statements.
The DOJ only approached Prince Andrew as a witness after Epstein's death in August 2019 and a BBC broadcast in November 2019, not during Epstein's lifetime.
The story alleges Berman's public implication that Andrew aided Epstein's crimes was an 'overt breach' of DOJ rules for engaging with witnesses.
The email is a journalistic request for comment on these allegations, planned for publication on June 15, 2020.
